1. Introduction

The Seeing Machines CoreData API is a set of libraries and tools for interpreting and manipulating data produced by Seeing Machines products.

Features:

  • Open source
  • Multi-language: C++, C#, Python
  • Multi-platform: Windows, Mac OS X, Linux

The following table shows the engine output data produced by Seeing Machines applications. The DSS product also generates data that contains extra objects, these are available in the DSSData API.

Class faceLAB faceAPI DSS
CustomEventOutputData   X
EngineOutputData XXX

FaceOutputDatav2 XXX

2. License

The CoreData API is distributed under the GNU Lesser General Public License (http://www.gnu.org/copyleft/lesser.html).

3. Getting Started

3.1 Installation

To install the API, unzip the package appropriate for your platform to a path of your choice:
  • Windows: coredata-win32-3.2.1.65799.zip
  • Mac OS X: coredata-macosx-3.2.1.65799.tar.gz
  • Linux: coredata-linux-3.2.1.65799.tar.gz

3.2 The CoreData Distribution

The CoreData API consists of the following components:

  • C++ library, including a number of examples applications,
  • Python bindings (Windows only)
  • C# bindings (Windows only)

The API is organized into the following directory structure:

coredata-3.2.1.65799/ <-- User selected installation directory
  coredata/         <-- C++ library 
  cscoredata/       <-- C# bindings (Windows x86 only)
  pycoredata/       <-- Python bindings (Windows only)
  swigcoredata/     <-- Swig files (Windows only - for generation of bindings)
  doc/              <-- API documentation

Further details on the directory structure are provided in the library documentation for each component.
